page.title: 03FARMS AND HOUSES
page.content: THE LARGEST FARM IN OUR AREA IS NAFFERTON,720 ACRES.LIKE MUCH OF THE LOCAL FARMLAND IT IS OWNED BY LORD ALLENDALE ,AND RENTED TO A TENANT,IN THIS CASE NEWCASTLE UNIVERSITY.IT IS A FULL REPAIRING TENANCY WHICH MEANS THAT ANY PROFITS GO TO THE UNIVERSITY,AFTER EXPENDITURE ON MAINTENANCE AND CAPITAL EQUIPMENT.IT HAS 12 HOUSES,5 BEING USED BY FARM STAFF,AND 1 BY A RETIRED WORKER.THE WIDOW OF A FARMHAND IS ABLE TO STAY ON IN THE HOUSE UNTIL SHE ELECTS TO BE RE_HOUSED ELSEWHERE.THE OTHER HOUSES ARE USED ON A SHORT TERM BASIS BY UNIVERSITY STAFF NEW TO THE AREA UNTIL THEY CAN FIND PERMANENT ACCOMADATION. BECAUSE THERE ARE NO LOCAL SHOPS OR PUBLIC TRANSPORT FROM THE FARM, RE_ HOUSING ELDERLY WORKERS IS GIVEN PRIORITY BY THE COUNCIL WHO CAN PROVIDE A HOME IN THE NEXT VILLAGE.
